definition: to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)

sentences.english: According to data of eye-witnesses around Nablus tanks were stationed also approximately.
sentences.chinese: 据资料目击者纳布卢斯附近的坦克也派驻了大约。

sentences.english: Five doctors have been stationed at the temporary shelter.
sentences.chinese: 五位医生派驻在临时住所。

sentences.english: The soldiers posted abroad in 2001 rotated home last year.
sentences.chinese: 2001年派驻国外的士兵去年轮换调防回国。

sentences.english: Countryside characters, Ed and Edwina Hedgehog, Tom Mouse, Sam Rabbit and Badger.
sentences.chinese: 农村字符，教育署及派驻刺猬，汤姆鼠，黄兔，獾。

sentences.english: Guards were stationed around the prison.
The client is encouraged to carry out his own inspection during the fabrication.
sentences.chinese: 建议客户在加工期间派驻自己的监造人员。

sentences.english: And they departing, made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们就去，在石上加了封条，派驻卫兵把守坟墓。

sentences.english: The troops stationed along the border three years ago have been rotated back to their original positions.
sentences.chinese: 三年前派驻在边境的部队现已轮换调防原地。

sentences.english: With the construction of the International Space Station, some astronauts are now required to live in space.
sentences.chinese: 随着国际空间站的建立，一些宇航员已被派驻在那里。

sentences.english: Accredits the personnel wages and welfare and the enterprise gets unhooked, An Jianju direct leadership.
sentences.chinese: 派驻人员工资福利与企业脱钩，受安监局直接领导。

sentences.english: And he put the valorous captains in all the fortified cities in Judah.
sentences.chinese: 又在犹大各坚固城内派驻勇敢的军长。

sentences.english: The regiment is stationed in Greece.
The author make a study of the Qing Army dispatched to Tianjin.
sentences.chinese: 本文对派驻天津的清军力量作了研究。

sentences.english: Each member nation also had an in-country U.S. team.
sentences.chinese: 经济合作署在每一个计划成员国都派驻了工作小组。

sentences.english: Currently, the British presence in Afghanistan has more than 9,500 officers and men.
sentences.chinese: 目前，英国在阿富汗派驻有9500多名官兵。

definition: to select/to detail/to set apart/to appoint
to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
